Description: Fragment of an ostracon from a pottery vessel in a closed shape with a pot-mark on the outside that was incised after the vessel was fired. The pot-mark is perpendicular to the turning lines of the vessel. It shows possibly an animal facing to the left, with the head missing. Maybe a gazelle or similar in a standing pose, another line behind it. The vessel is wheel made with a pinkish self-slip and made of a Nile clay.
